title: Faith
question: Have I denied that I was a Catholic, or openly expressed my disbelief in any doctrine of the Catholic faith?

title: Faith
question: Have I affiliated myself, even for a short time, with a non-Catholic sec or religious body?

title: Faith
question: Have I suggested or encouraged doubts about the Catholic faith in the minds of others?

title: Faith
question: Have I seriously expressed hte opinion that all religions are equally good or equally true or equally pleasing to God?

title: Faith
question: Have I neglected to settle, by reading studying, consulting, etc., serious doubts about my faith, when such neglect was evidently leading to a lss of faith?

title: Faith
question: Have I, without the necessary permission, read or kept or given to others forbidden books, such as Protestant Bibles, books on the Index of Prohibited Publications, books that pretend or profess to disprove the truth of the Catholic faith or that profess to prove the truth of a religion contrary to my faith?

title: Faith
question: Have I joined a secret society forbidden by the laws of the Church, such as the Masons, the Oddfellows, etc.?

title: Faith
question: Have I taken part in the Protestant church service?

title: Faith
question: Have I contributed to the advancement of a non-Catholic religious sec or movement as such?

title: Faith
question: Have I consulted a fortune-teller in the serious belief that I could learn something about the future, or made others think that I could tell their future when I know that there was no adequate natural means of doing so?

title: Faith
question: Have I attended a spiritualistic seance?

title: Faith
question: Have I planned to marry, or actually pretend to enter the state of marriage, before minister, or a judge, or a civil magistrate? Have I approved of other Catholics doing this or stood up for them when they did it?

title: Faith
question: Have I, without the necessary permission or reasons, sent my children ot an non-Catholic grade school, or approved of other Catholics doing so? Or without serious reason approve by the diocesan authorities, to a non-Catholic high school or university? Or have I done theses things without making any provision to safeguard the faith of my children?

title: Hope
question: Have I said or seriously thought that God was too merciful to condemn anyone to hell, and that, therefore, despite my serious sins, I would surely be saved?

title: Hope
question: Have I continued in a habit of mortal sin because I believe that some day I would certainly have the grace to repent and be forgiven?

title: Hope
question: Have I committed a mortal sin just because I expected God to forgive me in confession afterwards?

title: Hope
question: Have I neglected saying any prayer whatsoever for as long as a month at a time

title: Hope
question: Have I refused to pray in a grave temptation because I did not want God to help me overcome it?

title: Hope
question: Have I deliberately entered a serious and unnecessary occasion of sin, thinking that God would miraculously preserve me from sin or graciously forgive me if I fell?

title: Hope
question: Have I induced others to commit a sin by telling them that would forgive them afterwards?

title: Hope
question: Have I said that I did not believe in eternal hell?

title: Hope
question: Have I said or thought that it was impossible for me to overcome a certain passion or sinful habit?

title: Hope
question: Have I believe that because my sins in the past were so numerous or so terrible, I could not expect God to forgive me?

title: Hope
question: Have I quit going to Mass or praying because of the thought, "It doesn't do any good"?

title: Hope
question: Have I seriously complained that God sent me more trails that it was possible for me to bear?

title: Hope
question: Have I stopped praying for the grace to avoid sin and save my soul because God did not grant me a certain material favor for which I prayed?

title: Hope
question: Have I given up trying to overcome interior temptation because God would not take the temptation away?

title: Hope
question: Have I used poverty as a reason for committing certain serious sins, because Id id not believe that God could give me any material aid?

title: Hope
question: Have I scoffed at the joys of heaven, saying I would prefer to have heaven here on earth

title: Love Of God
question: Have I neglected to fulfill the percept of going to confession at least once a year?

title: Love Of God
question: Have I failed to observe the law which commands me to receive Holy Communion during the Paschal season?

title: Love Of God
question: Have I missed Mass on Sunday or a holyday without a sufficient reason?

title: Love Of God
question: Have I, as a mother or father or guardian, caused or permitted my children who are above the age of reason, to miss Mass on Sundays or holydays of obligation?

title: Love Of God
question: Have I induced others to miss Mass on Sundays, or approved of their so doing so

title: Love Of God
question: Have I without reason come late to Mass, missing the Offertory, or have I left before the Communion of the Mass?

title: Love Of God
question: Have I tried to do serious bodily injury to nay person consecrated to God?

title: Love Of God
question: Have I engaged in servile, work such as gardening, building, repairing, sewing, laundering, etc., for more than two hours on the Lord's Day, when there was no urgent reason for doing so?

title: Love Of God
question: Have I broken a serious vow made to God, by which I had bound myself under pain of mortal sin?

title: Love Of God
question: Have I committed a sacrilege by receiving the Sacrament of Communion, Confirmation, or Matrimony while the state of mortal sin

title: Love Of God
question: Have I tried to lead a person bound to God by the vow of chastity into sin again his vow?

title: Love Of God
question: Have I stolen something valuable from the House of God, whether an article used in divine services or money given to the Church?

title: Love Of God
question: Have I deliberately mocked or made fun of the Sacrament of the Mass or any of the liturgical functions?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I denied any of the attributes of God e.g. saying that He is not all-powerful, all-merciful, all-just, etc. ?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I said that I did not believe in God's providence, either directly by denying that He watches over all who love Him,or indirectly by saying that it is necessary to sin to avoid certain hardships?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I spoken with contempt, of God, or Christ, or of the Holy Eucharist, or of the Passion of Christ?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I deliberately expressed the wish that there was no God, so that I could in without fear of punishment?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I accused God of cruelty, injustice, discrimination against me, because of some sorrow I had to bear?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I wished evil to God - for example, that He would be forgotten by men and offended more frequently?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I spoken slightingly or contemptuously of the Mother of God, or of the saints, or of monks, nuns, priests as such?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I ridiculed the Sacrament of the Mass or any other holy ceremony?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I said that God did not and could not have inspired the Bible, or that there are things in the Bible that need not be believed?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I said that Christ did not found the Church, or that He has not preserved it from error?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I said that God expects too much of an individual by imposing the ten commandments on him?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I stated that any one of the commandments of God or precepts of the Church cannot be observed by ordinary folk?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I said that I owed nothing to God and therefore did not need to go to Church or practice any religion?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I denied the miracles of our Lord, or attributed them to deceit or natural causes?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I sworn falsely at a public trail, deliberately telling a falsehood when I had taken an oath to tell the truth?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I lied about important matters to which I had to swear in drawing up a statement or answering a questionnaire, e.g., pretaining to insurance, position, taxes, etc.?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I sworn to God that I would keep a certain promise or perform a certain work when I did not intend to do so at all?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I deliberately called upon God to witness the truth of a lie that I told someone in private?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I sworn to God that I would do something gravely unjust, like defrauding a neighbor, taking revenge, hurting someone?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I deliberately cursed a human being, which means seriously wishing or asking that God condemn his soul to hell or visit some other grave misfortune upon him?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I twisted the words of Christ or of the Bible into an obscene or evil form?

title: Reverence for God
question: Have I, as a parent or guardian, blasphemed or cursed or sworn falsely before my children or even to my children? Have I encouraged other to commit any of the above sins?

title: Chastity
question: Have I allowed my eyes to wander in curiosity over dangerous sexual objects?
description: The virtue of chastity is called the angelic virtue.
counsels: Many saints suffer from this sin

prevention: be in a public place, never alone.
